FuncDef:
The tcp window command sets the size of the sending/receiving buffer of the connection-oriented socket.
The undo tcp window command restores the default size of the buffer.
By default, the size of the packet sending/receiving buffer of the connection-oriented socket is 8K bytes.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the size of the packet sending/receiving buffer of the connection-oriented Socket.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 32, in KBytes.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Running the tcp window command changes the TCP window size that is used for setting up a TCP session.
Configuration Impact
The tcp window command sets the size of the sending or receiving buffer of the connection-oriented socket. The size is used for TCP session establishment.
Precautions
If this command is configured for several times in the same view, only the last configuration takes effect.
You are recommended to configure the parameters under the guidance of the technical personnel.
